Reviews.Title: “Good Central location and nice and clean.”
Reviews.Author: samgis1998
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the "Holiday Inn" as the second part of my scholl Ski-ing trip. I only stayed here for 1 night, as a result i didn't get a good look at all of the hotel and it's facilities. The hotel is only a 20 minute walk from the Empire State Building and 30 minutes from main night life like Times square and Broadway. The room were very clean and tidy and up to a very high satndard. However, the main problem there is the terrible slow lifts, which go straight past you even when you've pressed the button. If your in a hurry and on the 15th floor like i was then i would recommend to take the stairs. I only had a packed lunch styled breakfast as we were leaving early in the morning to go out sightseeing. The breakfast was the worst breakfast i have ever tasted and the scrambled egg was a bit black and tasted "gone off". overall the hotel is very nice and clean and in a good central location, but don't try there packed liunch breakfast and try get a lower floor room as you could be waiting a long time for the lifts.

Reviews.Title: “Spring break”
Reviews.Author: Jx3Derbyshire
Reviews.Content: From arrival to departure, reception to cleaners we were met with friendly, smiling, polite staff. The hotel suited our needs and location was excellent. On the sightseeing side of things highly recomend booking on line for relevant attraction BEFORE your departure, this is organised and recognised queue jumping, saves a lot of time.

Reviews.Title: “nice, intimate hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveler0991
Reviews.Content: nice location in chelsea on 26th betwenn 7th and 8th ave. easy walk to many attractions, and of course there's the subsay and cabs, too. excellent staff, friendly. nice 24 hr. pharmacy/sundry store and great deli/food store around the corner, also 24 hrs. you will do well. small, but pleasant rooms, a la NYC. very recommended. oh, also restaurant and bar attached to the hotel. we had a good time. 2 double beds. crowded for 3, v. crowded for 4, a la NYC. or go spend 3000 a nite at the plaza... only 2 elevators, sometimes a wait, usually no big.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms just a tad bitt small.”
Reviews.Author: l k
Reviews.Content: Love this place. Comfortable rooms, good value for NYC. Nice breakfast. Location is perfect for Times Square and also Broadway shows. For the value, will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “2 days at Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: davisj1501
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the 125 W 26th st Holiday Inn. Starting to like the HI Express hotels mostly for the free breakfast since they have a pancake maker now that actually make good pancakes, Im sure most of you know its expensive in Manhattan. The room is average wit very slow elevators especially in the mornings at check out. The room was clean and nice comfy bed not a lot of noise in the hallways like more hotels in Manhattan you always here a door slamming or the cleaning crew chatting it up outside but did not hear a word as i slept the morning away after my free breakfast. i would stay here again because of the location to MSG another nice restaurants all around

Reviews.Title: “Solid Value with great restaurant”
Reviews.Author: jhjr
Reviews.Content: This is one of the one of the "sliver" hotels that are quickly going up in and around midtown and chelsea. The rooms are very tight and I agree with some of the reviewers that the beds seemed shorter than usual. However, the room was spotless and everything worked. I did not have trouble with noise. We were in a two queen room and these are actually larger than the king rooms, so when I say tight I mean it. The hotel is well located for Madison Square Garden and Penn Station. The best part of the hotel is the restaurant - run by a very affable chef who genuinely enjoys cooking for his guests. The food is mostly Italian but the cheeseburger was great too. There were good specials every night and the bar area was generally full with two or three large screen TVs for sports viewing. There is also outdoor seating for the restaurant. We ended up eathing at the hotel restaurant twice because we liked it so much. Front desk staff were efficient and friendly, but you could see that with a crowd they might get overwhelmed. When we left, the doorman offered a car service to the airport. I could have sworn he told me $39 but when we got in the car the driver told us $79. I simply apologized and we got out and took a cab, but this appears to be an issue based on some earlier reivews. As it turns out, the car service price of $79 wasn't too far above the taxi fare to Newark airport. Overall, this is a great value hotel in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location.”
Reviews.Author: JoWhe
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very reasonably priced, considering the cost of NYC hotels in the area, and so I opted to stay here based on that. My expectations were not huge, and I can say that they were met. The hotel was clean, the staff friendly and it felt very safe. We paid extra for an Empire State Building view, and it really felt worth it. It was so lovely to see the building lit up in lights every evening. We also got a great view of the Chrysler. The hotel is in a good location, though it is slightly further from Times Square than I would opt for in future. It's a nice walk to Times Square, but the number of road crossings as well as the busy streets, means it often takes longer than most people would like. The train station (Penn Station) and tube stops are within a few blocks, and so its very handy for travelling in and out of the area. It gets much quieter from 34th steet around Macy's to 26th street where the hotel is located, especially at night, so it can feel a bit less safe. But I really found no trouble. One downside is there aren't many restaurants in this immediate area, so it's not so convenient for grabbing some food on a busy evening. Other downsides - there is no safe in the rooms, the lifts are slow, and the rooms are tiny. These things are not massive issues, and are easy to accept in any 3 star hotel. I would just urge to keep room size in mind if booking in a group. We travelled in a group of 3 and opted for a room with two double beds. It felt extremely cramped, as there wasn't anywhere for us to lay our suitcases or properly store all our things. It was fine for the purpose of our relatively short trip. However, we had considered travelling in a group of 4, and would have opted for the same room size - this would have been a much bigger problem, and I'm not sure how we would have squeezed 4 of us in. Overall, if you are in NYC to see the sights (who isn't?!) and want reasonably priced accomodation that is fit for purpose, then don't hesitate to come here. If you want something a bit more spacious, luxurious or closer to Times Square, then be prepared to pay the higher price.

Reviews.Title: “Ok location. Nice clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Dollie91
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for five nights, really nice hotel. Was really clean and a nice bathroom and bedroom but was really small. The location was ok. Was a 15 minute walk from times square. We felt fine walking around at night but in between the hotel and Madison square gardens it felt a bit dodgy. I would want to stay closer to times square next time but a nice hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location”
Reviews.Author: KathleenCT
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers stated, the rooms are smaller and the beds seem shorter in length, but that doesn't bother me because I'm not in the room longer than for me to sleep and get ready for another day in the city. The price was right and I don't have any complaints on the slowness of the elevators, like some of the other reviewers. I did get to the hotel late the first night and was so tired that I ate dinner down in the restaurant, which I normally do not do. The chef came out and discussed the menu with me and with his recommendation, I ordered the grilled filet of salmon in lemon butter with sauteed spinach and REAL mashed potatoes. A glass of Chardonnay complimented the meal and I can tell you that the meal was really, really delicious. The hotel was clean and the front desk persons that helped me, always looked straight at me while we were talking, and all had smiles on their faces, which means a lot when you are dealing with the public. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for location”
Reviews.Author: bigrossco
Reviews.Content: the location of the hotel cant be any better which a short walk to Times Square area for eating out and all the theatres it is very handy. The hotel is also a short walk from the Empire State Building as well so handy for those who want to go there. The downside of the hotel I found was the rooms were small We were in room 1403 and near the end of the holiday a leak developed in the bathroom from the room upstairs however looked like this was an on going problem and also the tiles in the bathroom were also in a bad need of a clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Very central”
Reviews.Author: erroltho
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights at the start of March. Hotel is very central... only a few blocks from Hearld Square & Times Square. Rooms were a little smaller than I had hoped for but were adequate. The common areas need some refurbishing but that is the only fault I could give regarding the accommodation areas. There is a small bar attached to the hotel. The music played in there is far louder than it needs to be. Ate in the restaurant on one evening also... it was nice but with the price that they charge, you may as well eat somewhere else in NYC! I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget option in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: artichokes
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights for a conference nearby. Loved the location and the price on Priceline. Hotel has quite a bit of wear and tear, but the important things are in tact--clean, nice shower, and comfortable bed. We had very noisy neighbors, and the hotel refunded half a nights stay for our inconvenience. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jules558
Reviews.Content: Just back from 5 days in New York and have to say this is a great hotel. As a tourist and wanting to see everything its in a great location. Close enough to walk to Macy's, Times Sq and near enough for the subway to go elsewhere. Staff really friendly and helpful. I flew from the UK and my sister in law from Texas and they made sure our rooms were on the same floor. Nothing was too much trouble for them. Had a meal in the hotel on our last night and wished we made it the first, the food was fabulous!! Chef was great, really friendly and took the time to come and talk to the guests. Pets are allowed in the hotel and the dog show was on at Madison Sq gardens, plenty of dogs staying in the hotel but did not hear a thing. I have read some comments on here saying its a noisy hotel, well let me tell you, I never heard a thing. Beds really comfortable, clean rooms, great view of the Empire state from my room. My next trip to NYC I will certainly be staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “just okay”
Reviews.Author: meanchat
Reviews.Content: The positives for the hotel is that it is very centrally located to Chelsea and midtown with convenient access to the subways. The complaints about the elevator waiting times depend upon the time of day. These sliver hotels should really have a dedicated elevator for service personnel. As there were some repairs taking place in the hotel when I checked in, the trip to my room on the 24th floor took about 10 minutes. The king rooms are quite small. I asked for a corner room with two double beds and the room was somewhat larger, although I still managed to band my foot on the furniture while accessing the wardrobe. Fortunately, there was a nice view of downtown which made the room more bearable. There was no soap in the bathroom and the tv volume was not working. The internet connection was also very slow. Also, be aware that there is no safe in the room. Although there is an ironing board, I am not sure exactly where it would fit if one had to iron. The bed was comfortable; however, there was some banging noise from the construction which came through to the room. The parking garage was a block away at $30 with a validation sticker from the hotel. There is another garage right across the street, which would be more convenient. I also noticed food delivery men going right up to the rooms without having to stop at the front desk. As the rooms did not have safes, I did not feel comfortable leaving valuables in the room when I had to step out. I was greeted as a Priority Club Platinum upon arrival and offered a choice of a snack. The upgrade to the corner room was appreciated as well. I think that the hotel was a good value for the price paid, but I would not rush to stay here again based upon the above.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhere to Sleep”
Reviews.Author: Sean M
Reviews.Content: I was in town for just the weekend - Friday to Sunday to hang out with some friends. I chose this hotel because it was close to the subway and pretty much everywhere else. Being on 26th and 6th Avenue - its pretty close walking distance to where you need to be. If you prefer taxi, then a cab won't cost too much being as its pretty central to most places. The lobby is pretty small and the elevators are slooooooooooowwwwww. Wow - for a hotel that has about 20 floors, having only 2 elevators that move that slowly was a pain at times. To walk up to the 8th floors, I would've needed to walk down to the basement then walk up - so most times, I just waited. I was on the 8th floor - and got a king size bed. The bed took up 90% of the space, but apart from that - the bathroom was large enough to not feel cramped and there was a desk where I could rest my laptop and respond to emails; the tv there was also pretty good and the channel selection isn't bad either. Truth is, I wasn't there much other than to sleep - heck, Im in NY - so the size of the room didn't make that much difference to me!

Reviews.Title: “Good value central hotel”
Reviews.Author: abi12345
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Manhattan for a week in January 2012 and found the hotel to suit my needs very well. My priority is generally location and this hotel is very central with several subways within a short walk and many areas of Manhattan within walking distance from the hotel. The rooms are small but clean and bright and cleaned to a high standard every day. I got a very good deal from booking.com and was very pleased with the value. It is a simple hotel without any bells and whistles but it did for me - no complaints about the service. I also had a few drinks in the bar which was surprisingly lively and welcoming for a hotel bar, and the food in the restaurant was very pleasant. The only thing I would say is if you're looking for a very quiet hotel this one probably isn't for you - it was busy and a bit noisy at the weekend. Although to be honest if you're looking for a quiet relaxing hotel you might want to look somewhere other than Manhattan!

Reviews.Title: “good location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: yerbamate
Reviews.Content: booked for a week a room with city view facing the empire state building ,which i got in my 3rd day and it was a very nice view of the uptown buildings.the first room was quiet small(really small) that i could hardly manage the space to store my luggage.the 2nd room was a bit more spacious and i had a mini refrigerator brought to me upon request.very clean and quiet rooms ,were hundreds of tv channel and good selection ,not too many bathroom toiletteries,but that was ok,because i always carry mine. the area is pretty safe and you have a lot of restaurants and shops around,not to mention the area atractions like broadway,empire state building and the time square.are a few blocks away .unfortunately i had to move after that week because suddenly the rate jumped to double the price.anyway,,if i come back i would like to visit this hotel again,because the staff there was helpful and nice.hope they will always be good to their guests

Reviews.Title: “Small Holiday Inn property”
Reviews.Author: ALLIGATOR9
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and located in chelsea. We stayed on out overnight trip to NYC and checked in since we were to have a late night with friends and returning to New Jersey would have been difficult. Also it was closer to the restaurant we were to dine at and our friend's house. Neat small rooms and a small lobby. No complaints and for the price we paid it was a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money !”
Reviews.Author: Thekingsolomon
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights in a double bed room. The room is very small but it was comfy and cozy. The hotel staff are nice and kind and the housekeeping service is good and clean. Free WiFi connection is a little slow but you don't need more than that. Location is great. You can use F, R & N train that are one block away from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful !”
Reviews.Author: hotels310
Reviews.Content: I was on my biz trip for a week and booked hotel online. Pics shown in site were rosy but actual rooms are very cramped. hardly any space to move around the bed. not comfortable stay. worst part, person on the reception put me to private cabbie despite asking for Yellow NYC cab landing me into an altercation with cabbie. overall experience was bad. Never opt for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great First Time Hotel”
Reviews.Author: xjm911
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel really make you feel at home. Any requests were met with prompt service. The Resturant room service was some of the best I have had. The breakfast staff were very helpful and after a 5 day stay they were full of advice about best shopping and must see attractions, a real bonus! One suggestion allow plenty of time to get down in the lifts as they only have 2 seem to filled especially early morning and early evening. No safes in the rooms, but safety box available at reception. Yes I would stay here again! New York New York!!!

Reviews.Title: “I can say I liked the price and the cleaning, but not the service”
Reviews.Author: Furieri
Reviews.Content: I didn't pay much for NYC standards, and the very small room was very clean and looked new. The location was also good, close to a lot of subway stations and the fashion district and also walkable distance from the Times Square (if you don't mind walking a couple of blocks). The hotel was very crowded and you could few that because of the tyne reception and tight corridors. Unfortunately, I was charged for a breakfast I didn't take at the lobby bar and was told that the US$ 33,00 would be canceled later in my credit card since I had noticed the error when it was too late. It hasn't happened so far. I also asked for a plastic spoon and was told a "sorry, but we only have forks" and that was all the help I got. The front desk seems very chaotic and that's why I think I'll never get the 30 dollars back. The only promise I got is dependable of a post-it message on the messy desk to the manager who would arrive later.

Reviews.Title: “Good NYC room for a good price”
Reviews.Author: Roadrunner01
Reviews.Content: I recently went to the city for a one day shopping trip and found a room here for a great rate, comparable to other hotels in the area. Like most hotels in Manhattan, the room is small, however Holiday Inn maximizes the space as best it can. Check in was smooth, there is a restaurant in the hotel and times square, herald square, madison square gardne adn the empire state building are all within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central location”
Reviews.Author: Masiba
Reviews.Content: This holiday Inn is in a great central location, near a subway, Central Park and main shopping areas as well as some good eating places. The breakfast here is very good value and huge portions

Reviews.Title: “Nice but small”
Reviews.Author: George G
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel and great staff. Rooms were a little small, but it is New York and the location was great. Very good deal for the location. Will look into this again for my next visit to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, friendly, clean.”
Reviews.Author: Trauk
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed here in the last few years. It's a good location, about 10 mins walk from Macy's and just off 6th Avenue so it's easy to head up to Times Square or The Rockerfeller Centre. It can get busy at the front desk but all staff are really nice & helpful. Check-in is normally at 3pm but we got there just after 1pm and it was no problem to check in early. The rooms are clean, maybe a bit small as our room had two double beds in but we didn't spend a lot of time in there so not a problem. Definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfect”
Reviews.Author: bri01605
Reviews.Content: This hotel is small but it is really all you need. We visited NYC for 2 nights and if you are spending a lot of time in your room, you are not enjoying New York!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great night's stay here early in December”
Reviews.Author: elizabeth57Elkridge
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night in early December when meeting friends. The location is very convenient to the MegaBus stop near Penn Station and also to Macy's Herald Square. It was a nice day so I walked up to Rockefeller Center to meet my friends. Front desk staff was friendly but seemed to be bit overwhelmed with check outs and check ins. The lobby is very small so it isn't a place where you linger. The restaurant is right next to the lobby and I heard someone say they had a good meal there. A front desk clerk did apologize for the wait. When coming back from the theatre I actually walked all of the way back; there were tons of people on the streets. I really liked the Chelsea neighborhood and I would stay there again. The room was small but for one night and one person was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: Brady771
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent! The staff are wonderful and my room was as clean and comfortable as I would hope for. The bed was especially comfortable. I must disagree with the naysayers on here. The rooms are NOT that small...maybe I lucked out? This is New York City after all and I have stayed in MUCH smaller rooms! The elevator was no slower than any average elevator, there are only two. The value I got form Orbitz was unbeatable. The staff were not the least bit rude that I dealt with. Again, maybe I lucked out? The question in my mind is were you rude to them first? Overall I WILL stay here again...no doubt.

Reviews.Title: “An inexpensive place to sleep - not too bad.”
Reviews.Author: WhiteGatesNewYork
Reviews.Content: Things I liked: - The staff were friendly and courteous and helped me out with directions to Subway stations and so on. - The location is great. Sixth Avenue and 26th Street is not a bad part of Manhattan at all, close to everything including Madison Square Garden where I was seeing a concert. - The price was very reasonable compared to other hotels in the area. At $129 a night it was less than half the price of the Hilton Fashion District which is on the same street a few doors down (my other hotel option). - Free in-room wifi - and it worked well! - The room was clean and in good condition. It was certainly nothing special and it was small but overall fine. Things I disliked: - The ridiculous elevator situation! There was only one functioning elevator for a twenty five floor hotel which was shared by all guests and staff - including housekeeping. Even if both elevators were working I don't think it would have been much better. It was like taking the subway trying to get to my room on the twenty-first floor - I'd wait for fifteen minutes wondering if I'd even fit inside the packed elevator once it arrived and then it would stop on numerous floors on the way up, sometimes letting housekeeping staff in and out with their trolleys. Many people were annoyed by this! - I was told no housekeeping after 4:30pm (I wanted my room cleaned and couldn't get it done). - There's no late-night room service (after midnight). Not a problem for everyone. - Thin walls - the conversations from the hallway regularly woke me up. - I think security at the hotel could be better. - The lobby is cluttered and a mess - it doesn't give a great impression when you first walk in. Overall, it's not the kind of place where you'd want to spend a lot of time actually at the hotel. But if you're looking for an inexpensive room for the night it's actually fine.

Reviews.Title: “Family Robbed..No Holiday staying at your Inn!”
Reviews.Author: darlene b
Reviews.Content: This rating is for the Holiday Inn located on 125th West 26th Street, New York... This was a family trip ...12 of us altogether. 5 children and 6 adults. When I selected a hotel, I explained to the Reservation host that we were traveling with children and room size, amenities and cost mattered.I reserved 3 rooms and paid $475.00 each for what felt like a closet. I paid for services that were not available..no room service ! The price I was quoted for my cars was 45.00 per car instead I was charged 200.00...Holiday Inn rip off !

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: JamaicaGyal
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in a double room with two adults/one child, and loved the location. We saw shows on Broadway and at NYU, went to an event in upper Manhattan, took the ferry to see the Statue of Liberty and spent some time in the fashion district, all of which were easily accessible by trains, with a short walk to the stations. Room was basic, and our view was of the fire escapes next door, but it was clean and quiet, with comfortable beds. Desk staff were helpful in suggesting restaurants and giving directions, and our room was cleaned each day. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Courtney C
Reviews.Content: The room was small, but comfortable. The bathroom is tiny. Elevators at small and extremely slow. They do not have food service and when we requested glasses and a wine opener, we were told to go to the nearby/attached restaurant on the first floor. I think they could at least offer glasses and buy a cheap wine opener for guest services! We had to go buy one at the local drugstore. I was shocked to see the prices with tax. We could have been at a 4 or 5 star hotel with many more amenities so we switched to a nicer place in the upper west side for half the price! When we left on Friday Nov. 18, 2011, teamsters were out front with giant, inflated rats to harrass this hotel. Not pleasant. I would say the only positive is the location. Great fancy food store around the corner and the Chelsea neighborhood has a lot to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Agreed - nice but small rooms - also good price”
Reviews.Author: Frequentraveler_724
Reviews.Content: A freqent traveler to NYC when I just a room with a bed and someplace I trust to be clean I check on this hotel. A lot of time I can get in here with a real good price -- just over $100 for the night the other day when nearby hotels were $200 or $300. I have never had any complaints with the service over the cleanliness of the place. One time I had a problem with the TV remote they got someone to me quickly and another time I got there and the toilet in the bathroom I was assigned was running. They insisted on sending someone up to check and when they agreed that the toilet was running they apologized and moved me because they did not have a plumber at that hour of the night. Stayed there last week and the room was just fine. They actually upgraded me to one with a view on a high floor. I don't think I would pay extra for the view but it was fun to look out at night and see the Empire State Building, Chrysler Building, etc. all light up. The standard rooms are small. A desk, chair and a bed. No comfy chair if that is important to you. I have grown to like the neighborhood because it is fairly convenient for what I need but it is not fany like one of the major midtown hotels. 26th Street is nothing special for the most part but not too far away there are some nicer places to eat, etc. I have not tried the hotel's own restaurant but have heard nice things about it. Bottom line if you want a comfortable place to stay this will do the trick. Shop around on the price because some times it goes way up and even this trip I made the reservation on the Holiday Inn web and then they cut the price twice so I kept calling in for the lower price before my stay. Then at the last minute they jumped the price on the web back up around $20 but I saved $50 versus my original booking and as I said maybe $100 versus comparable hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Friendly Staff, Clean Hotel-- but Tiny Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Cusevisitor
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in early September for the US Open. The hotel is well located and the staff was very friendly and efficient. There is a nice bar and restaurant on the premises, though there are some good alternatives in the area as well. The rooms are clean and in good condition, but they are soooo small! There were three of us in a twin double and it was really close!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place !”
Reviews.Author: DebashisM
Reviews.Content: You cannot get a better place to stay in New York than this... In the Manhattan region, walking distance to every second place (its another thing that we went in the end of winter and it was still cold for our Indian skins). You can see the Empire State Building from left side of the property if you are in the upper floors (the lower floors would give you glimpse of other buildings). But although the distances are really less, if you take a cab, you might have to pay through the nose, as you'll have to go round in circles in the 'one-way roads'. Take a map with you, get to know the direction of the traffic, and simply by crossing the roads each time you'll be able to save a lot. Coming back to the property, the rooms are really small... but the room service makes up for it. If something you want is not available, they'll connect you to the nearest vendor and without any call charges too. A small restaurant in the Ground Floor caters to the room service, but I'd say its the best... loved it ! Free WiFi, free incoming calls, et al. They also have a discounted airport transfer service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good 1 night stay”
Reviews.Author: kickice
Reviews.Content: Just a one night stay, booked the day before, at a very reasonable rate for a mid town hotel. (About $160 with tax). Efficient check in by a friendly member of staff. Room was clean, comfortable double bed, everything was fine. As it was only a 1 night stay, I cannot comment on the cleaning of rooms or other services. Surprised at the complaints at 'small rooms'. For one thing, small rooms are often the norm in central Manhattan hotels. Secondly, unless I got lucky, the room wasn't small! More than adequate. For a short stay, I'd not hesitate to try this hotel again, especially if the prices remain so cheap for a hotel with its location!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Viraly_bryak
Reviews.Content: The rooms of the hotel are the smallest which I have seen. There is no everyday cleaning. They clean our room just 4 times during 7 days. Managers are rude and they know just one phrase "I just came here and know nothing and can say nothing to you". I wrote few times to the management of Holiday Inn by their official site, but they are even less competent and hepfull then managers from reception. Don't choose this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty rooms and poor service good location”
Reviews.Author: Guy P
Reviews.Content: Dirty rooms and poor service and rates are not cheap either. Room size is tiny but okay if there is just one person in the room. Not recommended for the business traveller as there is minimal closet space to hang up suit jackets or slacks. I have an idea for a new Priority Club points promotion - 10,000 points per stay if you can figure out where to place the ironing board. Holiday Inn used to be a brand you could rely for dependable quality, but sadly not any more.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what you want in NYC”
Reviews.Author: CDPM
Reviews.Content: I've been to New York a few times now, and I really think if your going for a short stay to see as much as you can and do as much as you can then there is no need to be staying in over the top and priced hotels. The Holiday Inn, was perfect for what we wanted this time round. We were only there for four days and so we weren't spending alot of time in the hotel itself. It's clean, foyer is small but has what you need and the staff at reception are friendly and willing to help with anything you need. The rooms are small, but most rooms in NYC are small. It was clean and the bed was comfortable and warm. It is in walking distance of nearly everything. You can easily walk to Madison Square Garden, Macy*s, Empire State Building and Times Square (although take the sub way if its raining its a good bit down from times square). It is near a few subway stations so everything is accessible to you from this handy little base. There is a bar in the hotel, which is small and drinks are priced a little steep but again I think its a New York city hotel thing so not just here. You can get food here also, although we only had breakfast which was lovely. (New Yorkers do the BEST breakfasts in the world!) Check in and out was simple fast and without fuss. We were given directions when we needed it. The hotel is clean and simple with all the basics that you need. There are only two small lifts which can be a bit annoying if your waiting for a while but that's not a reason for marking the hotel down. In all the hotel aspect of New York is only a very small part, unless of course your staying in a 5star or famous hotel. Once the hotel is clean and dry there is nothing else you really need and this hotel has it all.

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean up-to-date room”
Reviews.Author: Bondsammax
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 2 nights here in September. The overall impression is of tight spaces. The lobby is small and the room was small. It was a challenge closing the door to use the toilet. Also in order to see myself when I shaved I had to have my left shoulder partly in the hall outside the door (and I am a small guy). The room was small, but everything was new and the bed was quite nice. Really only room for one person to sit at the desk and a second person would have to sit on the bed to read, etc. While almost claustrophobic by American hotel standards, the room was in line with many we have stayed at in Europe. In fact most of the clientele seemed to be from outside the US based on the wide range of accents heard in the lobby. The room rates were quite good for a hotel in NYC. The discounted parking rate at the garage 1 block over was also excellent for NYC. The location is pretty good. You have to walk over 1 avenue and down 3 blocks to catch one group of subway lines (metro, underground), and 2 avenues over and 3 blocks down to catch another group of subway lines. You are about a block away from 5th Ave and a bit closer to Broadway (not shows the street). There are coffee and tea shops nearby and quite a concentration of US southern-style barbeque restaurants nearby. In summary although we “paid for our stay using our hotel points, the rates were good for NYC, but the room and bathroom were small by US standards and the hotel is pretty close (10-15 min walk) to subway lines. So if you don’t mind being cozy and want to save money in the big apple this place is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Barely acceptable”
Reviews.Author: rebecca t
Reviews.Content: The room was okay-a little overused and not replaced. The bathroom was moldy and had a hole in the wall. The room itself was clean but small. The location was great. It was close to everything-central park and subway. Staff was friendly. The price ws a bit high for what you get, but location is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good for what it is!”
Reviews.Author: AmityL
Reviews.Content: Got a good deal on this on priceline. Rooms fare very clean and totally fine to stay in if you just want somewhere cheap and easy. Very touristy clientele. They serve free breakfast in the lobby so it's swamped around 9am. The neighborhood is pretty blah - the block itself is pretty bad (old fur businesses) although I did like the Italian restaurant a couple doors down. And you can easily walk to other places in Chelsea. If you can get this room for under $175 do it =)

Reviews.Title: “Only redeeming feature is the location”
Reviews.Author: Shane W
Reviews.Content: Other than being in a great location, I was very dissapointed with this hotel. The room thaat I had was ridiculously smaall, as was the bathroom. Instead of central heating and cooling it had a window mounted AC which was right beside the writing desk making it impossible to sit at the desk with the AC running. When I asked for a power adapter to charge my laptop and mobile, I was told they had none a and would need to walk about 4 blocks to the local hardware store (you have to be kidding - for a $200 per night?). After travelling for more ethan 24 hours, when I arrived all I wanted to do was have a shower and sit down with a good cup of coffe and reaad the paper, so I went down to the restuarant and order a Latte and asked where I could find a paper. Insteaad of getting aLatte and decent papaer, I was served a luke warm glass of milk with some coffee added (without a doubt the worst coffee I have ever had), and teh only papare that they had for guests was some pathetic National paper instead of a regular local (NY) paper, and then to top it off the waitress had the audacity to be pissed off when I refused to leave a tip. I was booked in for another 2 nights on my way home from the US, but very quickly cancelled my second booking and stayed an extra couple of nights in Washington instead. As a Priority Club Platinum member, I have stayed countless nights in Holiday Inn properties all over the world, and without a doubt the Holiday Inn Manhaattan 6th Ave rates as the worst Holiday Inn I have ever stayed in - even worse than the one in darwin Australia where our room was flooded and there was a mouse and cockroaches in the room - now that's saying something! As a Platinum member I was also advised that I would be given a room on one of the upper floors with city views, but what I got was a room on the 11th floor (there are 24 floors) with a view of the brick wall of the cruddy looking building on the opposite side of the street.

Reviews.Title: “Small and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Tim D
Reviews.Content: Just spent 6 nights at this hotel and it was great. Small yes, looking a bit tired okay, but very friendly, approachable staff and a fair price for such a knockout location. For people like me who just want a room and a bed in a clean, safe & well located hotel, you could do a lot worse in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “50/50 on this one.....”
Reviews.Author: Schleins Girl
Reviews.Content: The boyfriend and I stayed 10 nights at Holiday Inn, 6. Avenue. I chose the hotel for the location and the price. Pros: Location. Most staff was very nice. Roomsize. Clean bathroom with tub. View. Cons: Everything was stained. Lamp, carpet, pillows. Torn bedspread and big holes in towels. No cleaning of bedroom. We had to ask for a cleaning, and even then the room was not clean. "Leftovers" on carpet from previous guest. All-in-all, I really liked the hotel and the location, but it was too dirty for me and the towels with the big holes? I don't understand that. You don't care enough about your guest to give them a nice towel?

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful views, good value, location a bit meh!”
Reviews.Author: bongokoala
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in November over the thanksgiving celebrations. I have a thing for a room with a view, so when we managed to get 5 nights for under £600 we jumped at the chance. Before arriving at the hotel we had a few dealings with their front desk and they were always helpful and polite. I would say that the staff here are very kind. On arrival our room wasn't ready so we took a seat in the lobby while everything was sorted. We had paid a little extra for an Empire State view room and this is exactly what we got. I cannot reccomend enough paying the extra for the view. However, the room was small, and it was a bit disappointing that the bed wasn't on the other wall as we had to move around to see the Empire State Building. Sounds silly, but it is a nice touch which would have made a big difference. The area the hotel is in is a bit quiet and a little grubby really. At nigh I never felt scared walking to or from the hotel, but I was pleased I was accompanied with my husband as without him I am not sure how comfortable I would have been. Transport links are fantastic with bus stops available at the end of the street and a subway station a couple of blocks away. For the price we paid I was very happy with the hotel. But a little part of me wished that I paid a little more for something a bit better.

Reviews.Title: “horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: guillermo o
Reviews.Content: expensive for a 3 star hotel,, tiny room, tiny bathroom, horrible view, I took my family there due to the hurricane, we live in NYC and we were evacuated, I paid 2 night in advance just in case we had to stay more away from home, after the first day we were allowed to return to our homes,,, I asked them to be reimbursed for the second night, obviously they said no, I just think these guys were only taking advantage of a situation, they should not be allowed to profit like they do,, its an abuse and somebody should do something to stop them

Reviews.Title: “NEVER stay here! It will will ruin you NYC experience!”
Reviews.Author: IvanIum
Reviews.Content: Rude and unfriendly staff, my room was only cleaned once in a whole week. Microscopic rooms, no mini bars, old smelly AC. It is really overpriced comparing to other offers.

Reviews.Title: “Losy place, tiny rooms, no mini bar, no every day cleaning. Not recomended.”
Reviews.Author: Aviroga
Reviews.Content: Me and my family had to stay here do to short notice for the trip and some event was going on in NY, so no many hotels had rooms in Manhattan those days. It was really a bad experience and we learned not to go to this kind of hotels in NY. Not recomended.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: FugitiveMind
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the center of city and gives a great chance to explore. However, the hotel lobby is very small so it gets crowded easily especially during check out (It gets lots of people with lots of bags). The worse thing about this hotel is the rooms, very small room with tiny toilet - The sink is so small as if i am washing my face, half of the water is going on the floor). Also, the bath was damaged and it looked very old. I did not find the staff very friendly nor rude, I have visited many Holiday inn hotel and i can consider this one of my worse. I

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel... Great location to explore the city”
Reviews.Author: Mavesv
Reviews.Content: We had requested two rooms on the same floor which they guaranteed prior to arrival and lived up to it when we got there. The rooms were ny small, but comfortable and clean. The front desk staff and bell men were extremely pleasant and helpful.. Specially on a crowded rainy day with so many guests not wanting to leave the small lobby in the pouring rain. We do like staying in times square better, but, if the price is right, do not hesitate to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms and slow elevators”
Reviews.Author: scottstevenson
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on points and I have to say I was a little dissapointed. The location is ok. It is fairly centrally located. The rooms were not that good though. I realize this is Manhattan and space is a premium but these rooms were excessively small. I mean, to open the bathroom door you had to squeeze around it. For the price, if I paid, it was extremely small and not that nicely anointed. Other qualms where that the sound didnt work on the tv. The elevators were painfully slow and always packed because of this. Lastly, the internet was also brutally slow. Would I go back? Maybe I'd it was the only one I could book on points in the area but other then that I would try elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good launching pad”
Reviews.Author: k2maui
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, quiet, but very small, no frills. Would be hard to have kids in the room. It is a good location if you want to explore more than just the Times square area, and be somewhere less chaotic. We walked both down to the village and up to Times square easily. Overall decent value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Close to office. Good for one person”
Reviews.Author: Wtrmlngurl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night for a biz trip. King sized bed, tiny bathroom(typical NYC fair). Lobby was teensy and jam packed with people. Room was nice and perfect size wise for one person (not sure about 2.) Raucous guests woke me up several times in the middle of the night and early am so i left tired and cranky but would return again and hope that i would have a peaceful night of sleep. Internet worked well and they gave you two choice of pillows (soft and hard) which i liked a lot.

Reviews.Title: “For my money, I would come back again!”
Reviews.Author: AbuDhabiWil
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights during our stay in Manhattan last year. The hotel was a little more than what I expect one in NYC to be; It was a little more spacious, a little less pricey and all the IHG warmth I can find! Close proximity to paid lots, AVIS, the metro. I would definitely come back to this one! The bar and bistro at the ground floor has a very friendly owner (and co-owner of the property).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Lucecitak
Reviews.Content: This hotel was more than what I expected. Great location , good service, clean rooms and the price was not too bad. The only thing is that the rooms are small but that is expected of any hotel in NYC...Would stay here again...Texas

Reviews.Title: “Friendly & convenient!”
Reviews.Author: CX4
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay in the lower Manhattan in the middle of winter! Metro station, convenience store, restaurants, dry cleaning... everything is in walking distance. The hotel is minion (small) and that says everything about the rooms' size or the reception! So don't expect large waiting halls or fancy elevators or spacious hall in tour room. If you have many luggage you will have trouble lodging them in the room and the wardrobe is also very small. Nevertheless, my room was always clean and the bed was comfortable! The employees were friendly and keen to help and they responded quickly to any questions or queries. The Italian restaurant next to the lobby is ideal for breakfast at very good prices! Overall a very satisfactory stay at a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, clean rooms, and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: jldsmd
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for family business and had a comfortable stay. We drove in to town and parked at a close parking garage (easier than anticipated). There were 3 adults in our party and we surprisingly fit comfortably into a room with 2 double beds. I will say that I think this is the smallest hotel room I have every stayed in- but it is NY. Very clean, nice linens, our room was a smoking room however had no odor. Also very quiet and great air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Do not take this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Amsterdam091
Reviews.Content: We have been with our kids in NY for 3 nights, and we booked a room with double beds at HOliday Inn. When we arrived at the hotel the staff( unfrendly staff) told to us that the room is not more available so one of our child has on the floor the accommodation:( The manager told to us that a next day will give to us another room but the next day we have received another small room and they refuse to put in our room a crib bed for our 2years doughter. Very unfrendly people and we paid 299$ per night. And another bed news is that they have BED BUGS!!! I am back from this hotel with a lot of itching:( Do not take this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “My first visit to The Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: owl-zat
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights and found the hotel to be fine and in a pleasant area of Manhattan which felt safe waking around the area and on up to Time Square. The underground is 2 blocks away and so only a couple of minutes by foot. The room was quite small but apparently that's normal for New York so I am not going to complain about that. I paid the extra for a view of The Empire State Building and wasn't disapointed seeing the place light up in different colours each night and on my first day and following morning half covered by the mist looking spectacular. Happy hour in the bar was great and with a board behind the bar displaying clearly all the different beers they stocked me and my mate tried them all during our stay. Justin the lad behind the bar was friendly and provided exellent service and we did have a snack of buffallo wings from the restaurant which were excellent too. I must say all the food being served look delicious. Whilst there a bulb went in the lamp and the flush on the toilet broke and so we reported both these problems on the way out for the day and when we retuned both had been rectified. The hotel offers free Wi-fi which for the non U.S travellers is obviously useful if you have internet access on your mobile and want to keep in touch with the world whilst your away. I would definately recommend this hotel to others when travelling to New York

Reviews.Title: “A miniature Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: Ryan.W
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I've stayed outside of midtown and wish I would have done it sooner. So much less crowded in this neighborhood. I liked the location and accessibility to both midtown and downtown. It is everything you can expect from a HI but in miniature. A tiny lobby, just two elevators (occassional wait time), small lounge, small hallways, and small rooms. The rooms are sort of like staying in an RV. Hotel staff all around were wonderful although some had difficulty with English. I plan on staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend getaway - loved the view of Empire State Bldg”
Reviews.Author: TAHWashington_DC
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a quick weekend trip to the city. Loved proximity to subway, easy to get uptown and downtown easily. Spent the extra 20 on a view of the Empire State Building, which was lovely to look at both morning and night with all the lights on. Room around corner from elevator was amazingly quiet -- NO noise from neighbors at all! That was greatly appreciated. Bathroom is small and super well-organized, whole place was very clean. We walked over and back from Penn Station, it wasn't far enough to need a taxi (except if you have large bags or kids, then maybe a taxi would help).

Reviews.Title: “Double bed rooms are TINY !”
Reviews.Author: travelingbluewolf
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, standard look for a newer or newly remodeled hotel. The staff was adequate. There was a lot of traffic in the small lobby, but the atmosphere was adult. Meaning there were no families and no young adults. The room was tiny. The original plan was for there to be three people in the room but the third person fell ill and had to back out. It worked out for the best because of the room size. We arrived late due to flight being rerouted. The staff didnt give me a problem about that but the rate they asked for when I arrived was $80 more than I had book online. After providing an email confirmation in print and online via cell phone. I was told that the manager would have to take care of it in the morning. Inevitably I was given a credit on the room and cash back on checkout. Make sure to bring print outs of confirmations. If you book directly and not through a booking engine, request that it be sent in an email. Besides these issues I was in town to shop and the location is great to all parts of manhattan via sbwy station (1 red line) one block away. You are only 10 mins away by sbwy to Times Square, but walk isnt that bad. Also you are 20 mins away by sbwy to lower manhattan. I ate at nearby eateries Cafeteria and Johnny's 25th. Also there is Whole Foods and a Dallas BarBQue within 10 mins walking. This hotel is good for its location.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldnt stay there - but great, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Ezzmay_Petunia
Reviews.Content: I would not stay here again. While the staff were very friendly and helpful, the room and whole facility is in dire need of renovation. In my room the carpet was dirty,stained, and smelly. The wall paper was peeling. The sheets put on the bed had holes in them, and overall it was very poorly maintained. The remote had no back, lights didnt work etc etc. This was compounded by a very small room (the pictures on the site are very misleading) with the airconditioner a foot away from the bed - so who ever sleeps on the left of the bed has an airconditioner blasting on them. The king size room did not have enough room for two suitcases to be put anywhere. The lift smelt like 'wet dog' most of the time. There was no bar fridge. It was depressing to be in the room and I could not recommend the hotel to stay in at all. While centrally located, I would stay somewhere else. Staff were lovely though - they just need to renovate the hotel. Shame really.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and rooms”
Reviews.Author: semsb
Reviews.Content: Staff was great,very helpful and accomodating. Room was on the small side but very clean and with great beds. Our room was nice and quiet. Would have prefered breakfast included otherwise no complains.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: davvidsd
Reviews.Content: Five nights,. 2 days after getting home bites started

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn NYC 6th Avenue”
Reviews.Author: IAD_ORD
Reviews.Content: A pretty bland, boring Holiday Inn which matches its neighbourhood. Located in Chelsea, the are is really nothing special but the subway is close. The hotel was clean enough, and the service was adequate. The room was tiny, barely enough room to move. We only had three people with luggage for one night, but the room was filled. The bathroom was just as cramped, if not worse. There was not much room for storage. We were on the 6th floor facing the street, and I could hear noise. Not a fan of this hotel, but it was a free night so really couldn't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Really perfect for everything in usa.”
Reviews.Author: Sabunitedkingdom
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel after getting a deal for 180 usd per night. We stayed for 5 nights on the 16th floor. The room was a little small but perfectly fine and clean. Great comfortable beds of good size and good bathroom. Yes you have to wait a fee mins for the lift in busy times but it's fine. Great location with a 20 min walk to times square. On Sunday's there is a lovely street Market down the road. Staff were good and helpful. Overall perfect for us. Will come again!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic comfortable value for money hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jenster30
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn in March 2011. The hotel is very new and very well furnished/decorated. The rooms are super - we had an Empire State View King Room - Fantastic! Spotlessly Clean - Lovely comfortable bed, Satellite TV, all mod cons. Great bathroom with good water pressure in the shower. Plenty of towels and lovely toiletries. Staff very friendly. Located on 6th Ave and 26th St (Chelsea). Nice quiet road but still near enough to everything. Can't recommend enough.

Reviews.Title: “Very, Very Small”
Reviews.Author: misctraveller
Reviews.Content: This is the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in. That might not matter to people who really just need a bed to sleep in, but if you have any intention of using your room as a home base for an extended trip it might be uncomfortable. There was barely any space to stash your luggage. On the other hand, being a new hotel, nothing was broken or beat up so everything looked nice. The room had windows that open which is always a plus and an LCD TV with HDTV service. The bathroom was very small but had some nice touches like a soft close toilet seat. The restaurant attached to the hotel seemed nice but I only had a drink at the bar so I can't comment on the food. The bartenders were friendly. The street the hotel is on is mostly quiet and is in a safe part of town, just a short walk from Penn Station (Madison Square Garden) and Herald Square. For the price, one could probably find a bigger room to stay in, but this was adequate for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “too small rooms, ugly reception, expensive”
Reviews.Author: PiotrG
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is nicely located in Manhattan when you enter the reception you have a feeling it is a budget youth hostel and not a 4 star hotel. The rooms are terribly small. Breakfast is expensive and not good at all.

Reviews.Title: “What a mistake!”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkOn_the_Road
Reviews.Content: So this shoots my theory that the Holiday Inn chain has been making great strides in upgrading its properties. Everything is new and clean at this hotel, but there is not much else to commend it. It is on a shabby street at the edge of the Fashion District. The lobby is so small and nondescript as to be off-putting (I felt embarrassed to greet a friend there). The elevators are slow and, god forbid that you try to take a ride when the housekeepers are trekking their carts and supplies to the upper floors. The friendly front desk staff cannot make up for the rooms they have to assign you - incredibly small, even by NYC or European standards. There was literally a three-foot aisle around each side of the king-sized bed. Although the shower was generous, the rest of the bathroom was barely larger than an airline toilet. One has to close the door to stand in front of the mirror, and squeeze oneself into the shower opening so that the door will swing past. This is definitely a hotel for small people and single travelers. If you prefer Holiday Inn properties, try the Indigo Inn, two blocks north on 28th Street, where the rooms are also small but beautifully designed. Or try the Holiday Inn Madison Square Garden on 29th Street and spring for a jacuzzi room that provides a spacious bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent --- I recommend it”
Reviews.Author: wallx3
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during the Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show. Everything was clean, and the staff was extremely helpful. The hotel is actually off 6th Avenue on 26th St. ... so there's little traffic noise. There's a nice little bar and great restaurant (Prime Cafe) attached to the hotel. Yes, the rooms are very small. The bathroom was downright tiny. However, you're in New York; why would you spend a bunch of time in your room? There is a "business center" downstairs with two computers that are free for guest use. If you really need to use a computer during your trip, I'd recommend bringing your own ... because the ones in the business center were almost always in use by other guests. Also, the hotel is pet-friendly .... always a plus. Easy walk to pharmacies, the subway and Madison Square Garden. I would definitely book here again! :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: RoelR
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located in the center of Manhattan, in the middle of 26th street between 6th and 7th avenue. Only two blocks away from the subways 1,2&3 (Times Square in 5mins) and three blocks from subways B,D,F&M (8mins to Rockefeller Center) The staff on arrival was very friendly, and although we arrived at noon, our view room on the 20th floor was already available. The room wasn't that big, but not cramped. Nice wide bed, but for me not long enough (I'm 1m92 or 6'3''). TV had more then enough channels, and the free wireless & wired internet worked like it should have, acceptable speed as well. The view from the room was excellent, with the Empire State Building and Chrysler Tower right in front. The bathroom had a big shower, hairdryer, toilet and a small sink. It was only a bit difficult to get in and out, because the door was too wide. We had to step inside around the toilet to close the door. A bit strange they used a door that wide for a not so big bathroom. Cleanliness was OK, only the shower wasn't entirely clean, nothing to worry about though. The staff in the lobby gave us a nice greeting everytime we went out or came back in. Storage of our luggage on the day we left was not a problem, and checkout went really fast. Lots of places to have breakfast or a quick snack on the way to the subway, and a nice restaurant adjecent & opposite the hotel. If there is a remark, it's about the elevators. There are only two of them, and no service elevator. That means in the morning, sometimes you'll have to wait a bit. We stayed for 5 days, but never had to wait longer then 1 minute. It probably feels longer while you're waiting :). Overall experience was very good, and I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good but small”
Reviews.Author: Gerald88
Reviews.Content: We requested for a twin bedding room, but the hotel only had double bed on the first day so the friendly receptionist promised us a twin room for the next 3 days of our 4 day stay, which we gotten and were very greatful. Location is good but not great, about 15-20 min walk to times square, I would recommend staying closer to madison square garden area. Room abit small, toilet small too.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: te6506
Reviews.Content: BED BUGS!!!!! That pretty much explains it all. I stayed here for one night while I was on business, and slept in the hotel for a matter of 6 hrs due to my delayed flight. When I left the hotel and got on my flight home, I realized I had terrible itchy welts all over my upper body. I went to the dermatologist in complete agony, and fear that it could be the bed bugs, while itching uncontrollably! My dermatologist was 100% sure that it was bed bugs and that I have to had contracted them the night before in NYC! The hotel was clean at a glance but it was absolutely bed bugs! After being on steroids for a week to get this out of my system and the pure horror of disgust I will never stay at a low range hotel again in NY especially this one! To all of the business travelers out there, I was shy away from this Holiday Inn in NYC. After sending my complaint to the Holiday Inn Manager, I was supposed to be contacted for damages and have not heard back yet. This makes me think that they are more guilty. Don't worry, to exterminate they use a certain kind of dog that can smell them, so if you see a dog in this hotel with hotel staff.... you will know the issue was not taken care of. Safe travels from an itchy and frustrated traveler. Never again would I stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable 2 Star”
Reviews.Author: Bookend48
Reviews.Content: Would rate this hotel as average 2 star property. Rooms are very much on small side. Beds are about 30" off the floor which is bit of shock to the body during the night. Little room other than for the beds. Free fast Internet was good. View looked out on to a factory. Bathroom on the small side. No bath but reasonable shower. No parking at hotel or nearby which was a drag especially at drop off. Coffee/Tea making provided. Room service fair priced selection. Hotel common areas are kept clean. Reception staff are helpful and plenty of them so no having to wait. Had early checking, around 11am. Heater keeps main room very warm but tends to result in cold bathroom area. Good TV with usual frustration of listing all the satellite channels that you can't access. Would book again but think overpriced at £77 for what you get but guess that's New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Years In New York!”
Reviews.Author: lovecentralamerica
Reviews.Content: What an amazing city!!!!! It was my first trip to New York City and we had a room on the 23rd floor with view of the Empire State Building, just incredible! Although the room was pretty small (I guess that's something you have to expect in NYC if you don't want to spend a fortune on a suite) it had almost all the necessities...internet, coffeemaker (no safe though). The staff was very friendly and helpful and the hotel is in walking distance of the subway (TIPP get a subwaypass for a week if you're staying long enough...it's a very quick and good way to travel). It's also in walking distance of Macy's if you don't mind a little walk...but that's the whole charm! I found walking was the best way of seeing the city! All in all, a very pleasant stay and I will definitely be going back to this hotel!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good place for the price”
Reviews.Author: NoseOverTail
Reviews.Content: An overall good hotel for the money, rooms and hallways were small like most people have already said but that wasn't a problem for us since we weren't in our room much at all. Everything was pretty much at a close enough distance for us to walk and the walk wasn't too terrible since there's so much to see along the way. The only complaints we had would be the cleanliness of one of the beds my friend slept on and a leaky sink. The front desk were quite friendly as well. We would probably definitely stay here again if we don't have the money to put down on a nicer place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value for NYC”
Reviews.Author: Trave1-A11
Reviews.Content: This was our first family trip to NYC and this hotel was a pleasant surprise. Easy walk to Penn Station. Front desk staff very friendly and helpful. The rooms are small but clean and nicely appointed. For one night, it was okay for a family of four, all adult-size. More than two nights, I'm not sure. For the location and the price, it is truly a bargain. I could have gotten two rooms here for the price of one elsewhere and been very comfortable. Probably 5 on Value, but is there a 5 in New York City?

Reviews.Title: “just perfect”
Reviews.Author: rotterdamboy
Reviews.Content: very friendly staff, nice room , great view on 24 floor perfect location . breakfast was very good and reasonably priced. been many times to new york but first time i have stayed here but can honestly say i will return here next time

Reviews.Title: “Would highly recommend this hotel..”
Reviews.Author: Maireadi
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights on the 5th floor. The room was small but sufficient for our needs - all we wanted was somewhere clean and quiet to sleep. The bathroom was perfect! All the staff were friendly and very very helpful. But the best thing about the hotel was the restaurant - consistently great food, lovely staff. At the end of the day when all we needed was a nice tasty meal and a good sleep - this hotel was just the business.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal!”
Reviews.Author: New_traveller17
Reviews.Content: We have just returned home from NY this week. This is an excellent location and great hotel. The staff were lovely and they charged my sisters Iphone on a couple of occasions for her as well. We booked two rooms with two double beds in each. The rooms were perfect in size and had cable TV. The hotel comes with free Wi-Fi so we were able to check facebook and email while we were away! The bathroom facilities were great, but I would recommend taking your own toiletries. We chose not to eat at the hotel because there were so many places to grab a bite to eat within a few seconds walk. The hotel had no issues with us bringing food back with us. We couldn't have been happier with the location of this hotel. It's perfect for exploring NY.

Reviews.Title: “what you'd expect from a 2-3 star in NYC”
Reviews.Author: dquinby
Reviews.Content: Nothing remarkable, but perfectly fine if you can get a good rate

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sls92249
Reviews.Content: Had room on smoking floor- No bed bugs. Room was clean. Accommodations were very cramped, but sufficient. Cafe on premises not run by Holiday Inn, but excellent prices, good service, clean. Front desk and lobby personnel very friendly and helpful. Within walking distance of Penn Station and 34th Street shops.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Excellent Location, NO BED BUGS!”
Reviews.Author: weluv2travel07
Reviews.Content: Everytime we come to NYC, which is frequent,we try to book this Hotel. It is fairly reasonable for NYC rates, and the location is excellent. It is midtown Manhattan, which makes it a nice home base. It is extremely clean, the staff is exceptional and we found no evidence of Bed Bugs! If you are tired and don't feel like going out for dinner, try the in house restaurant. Great prices and good food. The room that we got on the 23rd floor, had a wonderful view fo the NYC skyline!

Reviews.Title: “small but friendly”
Reviews.Author: laislapr
Reviews.Content: We were here for two nights. The hotel is very small same as the room and bathroom. We did not found bed bugs, thanks God, but the shower tiles grout was falling. Everything else looked clean, and the staff was very friendly. The hotel has free Wi-Fi. There is no chanrge for the use of internet at the business center and printing is free. Location is so-so, but is NYC and you should walk.

Reviews.Title: “bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: tglj
Reviews.Content: Room was tiny and difficult to maneuver around. Lobby was small. Bites showed up when I arrived home. Bug bites appeared in clusters of threes. On my wrist, on the side of my forehead, and my scalp! Yuck! On the other hand, location was great. Around the corner, there were was plenty of places of places to eat, shop, etc...

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant experience!”
Reviews.Author: LTDenver
Reviews.Content: Location is great (near the Fashion Institute and both red and blue subway lines). The check-in process was very easy. We requested a high floor and got one (22). Staff is very accommodating and friendly. We needed extra towels, called down and were told there was a limit in the evenings. However, someone showed up within 10 minutes with a nice stack of 4! Beds extremely comfortable. Rooms are small but typical for NYC. Check out was a breeze and bag storage was easy. The doorman not only retrieved our bags very quickly but ran outside with them to make sure we got a cab to the airport. Hotel is VERY clean and made our stay all the more memorable. If and when we return, we'll stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, convenient, practical”
Reviews.Author: PandoraBehr
Reviews.Content: I spent one night here and was really pleased with the stay. As other have mentioned, the rooms are not large and are probably soon due for a bit of an update, but in saying this, the facilities were great, the free wifi appreciated and the bed was one of the best I've ever slept in. It was superb . The staff were courteous and friendly - a little too service oriented (this is coming from an Australian who's only just getting used to US service standards). Would happily stay again - it's only a few blocks from Times Square and the Empire State building and I felt very safe walking the neighbourhood at night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: danieljamesbrown
Reviews.Content: Was quite impressed with the Holiday Inn, it was modern and clean, the staff were helpful and on the day we arrived (I think her name's) Arlene was great, offering us advice on things to do while we stayed in NYC. The room was quite small but big enough for us, the bed was very large and the facilities were good and room was clean. Nice flatscreen tv. The usual stuff such as the desk and the bedside tables were nice too. Hotel loctation was good, only a 5-10 min walk from Macy's and we walked to Times Square etc too. McDonalds round the corner handy for breakfast. Wasn't a noisy area, at night was a bit dark in places. Other good points: Hotel had business centre in the basement which had two computers and a printer which not many people used. I had forgotten to take shaving foam and a razor and thought it was nice that they gave me some in the hotel. The room had an iron and ironing board and a coffee maker (which i used to make tea) Only thing room was lacking was a fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Irresponsive staff”
Reviews.Author: Arash_2007
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room in this hotel, but never stayed there because of a change in my plans. I called the hotel to change my booking and postpone it to a date three weeks later. They said my name was not there and they didn't have such a reservation at all. 5 days later I found that they had charged my credit card for a room I had never stayed in! I wanted to call again, but I thought they would again give me the same who-the-hell-are-you answer!

Reviews.Title: “great friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: geordiegirl19
Reviews.Content: booked this hotel after reading other reviews on this site, pleased that i did as it was really nice, yes the rooms are small, and the view is not much but the room was immaculate and the staff on reception and elsewhere in the hotel were fantastic. Nothing was too much trouble to them and they helped us a lot and i felt that they were happy to do this. We were able to walk everywhere from hotel its about 15 mins to times square, and we even walked back from staten island ferry which took just under 1 hour but lots of sights to see on way back. Maybe could do with more tea/creamers in room but getting more was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: SRALAM
Reviews.Content: A standard room with s king bed cost $297+taxes taking a 3 night stay over $1,000. This did not include any breakfast or anything else except a bottle of water, cookies and a snack bar. The room was like a box with hardly any room for two people to move or store our belongings. There was no safe and the on ly complimentary items were two tiny shower gels and one moisturising cream. On two days we returned after 2pm to find the rooms not cleaned. Both days when I called the front desk responded as if it was my fault, stating that I put a "do not disturb" sign out. When they do not even have such a sign. Then on both days the cleaners came round and disturbed us when we were trying to rest. The front desk staff were rude and arrogant with no apology. They went on to say that they had a million things to do hence they were rude. I will never visit this Holiday Inn again

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: destinyschild
Reviews.Content: We arrived earlier than check in time and requested a room with shower not bath on a high floor and asked if we could check in early. A room as requested was allocated to us and we were checked in straight away by a lovely friendly and efficient young lady on reception. The room wasn't large but we got two double beds which were very comfortable. The room and shower room were spotlessly clean with plenty of towels, the aircon was powerful and we had enough space to store our shopping and suitcases. Each day the cleaning was excellent, and the staff on reception very pleasant and helpful. We didn't eat in the hotel or drink in the bar as there were so many other places to try. There is a business centre (very small but 2 computers and a printer) in the basement which was free to use, very handy for the on line check in before our flight. When I go back to NYC I will definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “EXTREMELY POOR CUSTOMER CARE - Forgotten things will NEVER reach you despite credit card decuction”
Reviews.Author: arenner
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Holiday Inn, 6th Avenue from 10 - 13 August 2010 . I forgot my sunglasses on the lobby desk, the front desk found it and a credit card deduction was processed for Fedex. Up to this date, I never received my sunglasses despite my several calls whch were connected to the Lost & Found where I could leave a message and am still WAITING for feedback. Johannes & Anousha RENNER from Pittsburgh

Reviews.Title: “Small, Convinient and Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: PuertoricanTraveler
Reviews.Content: Yes the hotel is small but very cozy. It has a bar and a restaurant area which is nice. Front Desk is always there to help. The location is superb! really like the surrounding areas of Chelsea. The subway is a short walk two streets up, which we learned to use, and was very convinient to see this beautifull city!! Rooms were good, small bathroom, nice tv and storage space and if you can get a room onb a high floor looking to the empire state building,, it is totally worth it to see it everynight and day!

Reviews.Title: “Clean Cozy Convenient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: roadhound1
Reviews.Content: Five of us ladies stayed at the Holiday Inn-Midtown Manhatten. It was a safe area and close to everything. We easily walked to Times Square and shopped along the way. Even though it is located on a street that is old, don't be deceived. Like any area of Manhatten-- there is lot of restaurants, shops, delis and clubs nearby. Just walk out to 26th St & 6th Ave and it is a show to people watch. Staff was super helpful and very nice. Service was quick and staff was friendly and helpful. It was a very busy hotel, small lobby & rooms, but sufficeint for what we needed. Only negative was slow elevators, but we dealt with that. Small lounge & restaurant is handy for margaritas after a long day on the streets. Rooms were clean, beds very comfortable. Doorman very helpful to get SUV for transportation to airport at good price. Great place to stay while touring Manhatten. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, but not 'excellent' as this hotel claims as its ultimate aim”
Reviews.Author: Hotchpotch_10
Reviews.Content: As with most NYC hotels, space is at a premium, and the rooms at this hotel are no exception. Although tiny, ours was relatively clean and comfortable - the two main things I always look for. The very pleasant lady who cleaned our room (and seemed to be alone and very much overworked) didn't provide toilet paper for the bathroom after the second night - I had to ask specifically. That's a very basic service, but since there was no fuss, not really a big deal. My main gripe relates to the fact that we had pre-booked a room with twin beds as part of a tour package (I was traveling with my father) but when we checked in, they had no twin rooms left, and didn't seem to care at all that a father and daughter would be forced to share a king for two nights - no apologies, no offers to see what they could do for the second night. They don't reserve specific rooms, they just give away whatever they can. Poor customer service. Waiting for the elevator was another major pain - one always seemed to be out of service, and the single available forever to arrive - cue irate crowds gathering in the lobby with huge cases. This was, to my mind, completely unnecessary. We stayed in a couple of other hotels throughout our trip, and had no complaints to speak of. Great location, reasonable price, but I think I'll search elsewhere if staying in NYC in future.
